articles.title: React
articles.subtitle: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
articles.excerpt: React is a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on components, maintained by Meta and a community of developers.

articles.title: Node.js
articles.subtitle: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine
articles.excerpt: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

articles.title: JavaScript
articles.subtitle: The programming language of the web
articles.excerpt: JavaScript is a programming language and core technology of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and CSS. 99% of websites use JavaScript on the client side.

articles.title: Web Development
articles.subtitle: The art of building websites and web applications
articles.excerpt: Web development is the work involved in developing a website for the Internet, ranging from simple static pages to complex web applications.

articles.title: TypeScript
articles.subtitle: A typed superset of JavaScript
articles.excerpt: TypeScript is a free and open-source programming language developed by Microsoft that adds static typing with optional type annotations to JavaScript.

articles.title: Express
articles.subtitle: A fast, minimalist web framework for Node.js
articles.excerpt: Express.js is a back-end web application framework for building RESTful APIs with Node.js, considered the de facto standard server framework.

articles.title: REST API
articles.subtitle: An architectural style for building web services
articles.excerpt: REST (Representational State Transfer) is a software architectural style that defines constraints for building scalable web services.
